thread.title: NAC roundup: Clemmer’s seven saves power Canton past Salmon River in girls soccer
thread.title_full: NAC roundup: Clemmer’s seven saves power Canton past Salmon River in girls soccer

title: NAC roundup: Clemmer’s seven saves power Canton past Salmon River in girls soccer
text:
Katie Clemmer made seven saves to lead the Canton girls soccer team to a 1-0 victory over Salmon River in an Northern Athletic Conference Central Division game on Wednesday. 
Mimi Husenic scored off a pass from Lauren Smith in the 18th minute for Canton (11-1 overall). 
Salmon River fell to 4-10, 4-9. 
POTSDAM 2, GOUVERNEUR 1 
Gabi Jones scored the game-winning goal in the 71st minute as Potsdam (11-3-1, 10-3) defeated the Wildcats in a Central Division game in Gouverneur. 
Sophie Fawcett scored the first goal for Gouverneur (5-7-2, 4-7-1) in the fifth minute. 
Savarah Aidun scored on a penalty kick for Potsdam in the 34th minute. 
MALONE 5, OFA 0 
Gabrielle Collins was part of every goal, scoring four and assisting on one, as the Huskies defeated Ogdensburg Free Academy (1-11-2, 1-10-1) in a Central Division game in Malone. 
Hayley Lewis also scored for Malone (10-3-1, 9-2-1). Victoria Hanna made two saves for the shutout. 
MASSENA 4, TUPPER LAKE 1 
Madeleine Mailhot scored twice as Massena (10-3-1, 8-3-1) defeated the Lumberjacks in a Central Division game in Tupper Lake. 
Kyrsten Stone and Taylor Convertini also scored for the Red Raiders. 
Sophia Martin scored for Tupper Lake (0-14, 0-12). 
HAMMOND 1, EDWARDS-KNOX 0 
Lilly Langtry made six saves as the Red Devils shut out Edwards-Knox (5-5-2, 4-5-2) in a West Division game in Hammond. 
Sierra Fleming scored off a pass from Mariah Simons in the seventh minute for Hammond (14-0-1, 11-0). 
HERMON-DEKALB 5, MORRISTOWN 2 
Kari Hance scored the game-winning goal in the 60th minute to lead the Demons (3-11-1, 3-9-1) past Morristown in a West Division contest in DeKalb Junction. 
Bridget Rust scored three goals for Hermon-DeKalb and Kylea McAdam also scored. 
Shaylyn Kasper and Victoria Mitchell scored for the Green Rockets (0-14, 0-11). 
LISBON 2, HARRISVILLE 0 
Hope Walker finished with six saves as Lisbon shut out the Pirates (4-8-2, 4-6-1) in a West Division game in Harrisville. 
Maddie Vine scored both goals for Lisbon (8-5-1, 7-4). 
BRUSHTON-MOIRA 2, COLTON-PIERREPONT 1 
Madison Rowe scored two goals, including the game-winner in the 47th minute, as Brushton-Moira (5-6-1, 4-6-1) edged the Colts in an East Division game in South Colton. 
Madison Gregg scored for Colton-Pierrepont (4-9-1, 4-5-1). 
MADRID-WADDINGTON 2, ST. LAWRENCE 0 
Two saves from Morgan Burns helped the Yellow Jackets shut out St. Lawrence Central (4-10, 3-9) in an East Division game in Brasher Falls. 
Hannah Marcellus scored in the 27th minute and Olivia Parmeter scored in the 47th for the Yellow Jackets (6-5-3, 5-4-2). 
CHATEAUGAY 7, ST. REGIS FALLS 0 
Danielle Charland scored four goals to send Chateaugay past the Saints (3-11, 1-10) in an East Division game in St. Regis Falls. 
Rachael Young scored one goal with two assists for Chateaugay (13-0, 12-0). 
Brianna Cook and Emily Trombley also scored for Chateaugay. 
BOYS SOCCER 
HARRISVILLE 4, EDWARDS-KNOX 2 
Jared Dreythaler finished with a goal and assist as the Pirates (11-2-1, 10-0-1) claimed the NAC West Division title with a victory over Edwards-Knox in Russell. 
Tyler Eddy, Payton Schmitt and Brennan Best also scored for Harrisville. 
Trent White and Jason Burke scored for the Cougars. 
VOLLEYBALL 
OFA 3, MADRID-WADDINGTON 1 
Taylor Perry scored 14 service points and added 10 assists to lead OFA to a 26-24, 24-26, 25-12, 25-13 win over the Yellow Jackets (5-8, 4-3) in a West Division match in Madrid. 
Kelsi Donaldson added 18 points for the Blue Devils (9-4, 7-0). 
CANTON 3, GOUVERNEUR 0 
Ticia Yerdon scored 13 points to send the Golden Bears (2-10, 2-5) to a 25-16, 25-15, 25-10 sweep of Gouverneur in a West Division match in Canton. 
Paige Corbine added seven kills for Canton and Angelina Vecchio scored eight points. 
Shannon Knowlton’s 12 points led the Wildcats (1-11, 1-5). 
GIRLS SWIMMING 
Alexis Peterson won two events to send Potsdam past the Cougars (1-6) in Russell. 
Peterson won the 50-yard freestyle and the 100 backstroke for Potsdam (5-4).
